Pre-Game Insights: India will field a revamped squad for the T20Is, marking the beginning of a new era without senior players like Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, and Ravindra Jadeja, who have retired from the format.
Suryakumar Yadav will be a pivotal figure as India’s captain and a proven T20 performer, and his ability to counter spin could dictate India’s fortunes against Bangladesh’s spin-heavy attack.
Riyan Parag has shown promise as a finisher and part-time spinner, and his performances could be a deciding factor for India’s middle order.
Shakib Al Hasan’s experience in high-pressure matches will be crucial, both with the bat and ball.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Gwalior, hosting its first T20I, is expected to offer a good batting surface with some assistance for spinners as the match progresses.
Under lights, dew could play a role, making bowling difficult in the second innings, favoring teams chasing.
